instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
Clean board, most of the time it will restart when the bar for the loading OS is mid way or near the end, sometimes it will load all the way but shortly after it will restart.

Already tried know good BIOS with clean ME.

Replaced <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR>.

Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.

Resistance between pins 17-18 and 27-28 is correct.

Battery lines SCL and SDA measures correct in diode mode.

Tested with known good battery.

Still same.

PPBUS with battery and charger 12.8V battery alone 12.2V

SMC bypass same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery, just charger?
Machine works good with battery alone (no charger)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
12.6V without battery 

Battery alone same problems as mentioned before.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
"Tested with known good battery."
Original Apple (really) known good, or just new one (supposed) to be good?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message: Tried 2 new ones, one original Apple and one aftermarket same as what we use here for all other repairs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
Any history available?

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>, with battery connetced; board turned on.

Does the machine restart booting Windows?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL> 0V with battery connected board on and charger disconnected
<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0.3V with battery connected board on and charger disconnected

 Don't have Windows but have Linux and it also restarts with battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts with battery connected
threads.message:
Then I suspect CPU issue.
When battery is detected, CPU working regime changes and crashes.
